TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit PolygonHotSpot extends System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot

Docs.summary: Defines a polygon-shaped hot spot region in an control. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This class defines a polygon-shaped hot spot region in an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ImageMap> control. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PolygonHotSpot> is useful for defining irregularly shaped hot spot regions in an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ImageMap> control. For example, you can use it to define individual regions within a geographical map.
To define the region of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PolygonHotSpot>, set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PolygonHotSpot.Coordinates%2A> property to a string that specifies the coordinates of each vertex of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PolygonHotSpot> object. A polygon vertex is a point at which two polygon edges meet.
When a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PolygonHotSpot> object is clicked, the page navigates to a URL, generates a post back to the server, or does nothing. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot.HotSpotMode%2A> property specifies this behavior. To navigate to a URL, set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot.HotSpotMode%2A> property to `HotSpotMode.Navigate`, and use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot.NavigateUrl%2A> property to specify the URL to navigate to. To post back to the server, set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot.HotSpotMode%2A> property to `HotSpotMode.PostBack`, and use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot.PostBackValue%2A> property to specify a name for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PolygonHotSpot> object. This name will be passed in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ImageMapEventArgs> event data when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PolygonHotSpot> is clicked. If you want the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PolygonHotSpot> object to have no behavior, set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot.HotSpotMode%2A> property to `HotSpotMode.Inactive`.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ImageMap> control that contains three <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PolygonHotSpot> objects. Each <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PolygonHotSpot> object represents a geographical region on the map. When the user clicks a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PolygonHotSpot> object, it posts back to the server and the type and name of the hot spot are displayed in a label.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this constructor to initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PolygonHotSpot> class.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to programmatically create a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PolygonHotSpot> object and add it to an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ImageMap> control. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ImageMap> control contains two other <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PolygonHotSpot> objects that have been added declaratively. Each <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PolygonHotSpot> object represents a geographical region on the map. When the user clicks a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PolygonHotSpot> object, it posts back to the server and the type and name of the hot spot are displayed in a label.
<!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-csharp[PolygonHotSpot.Cstr#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/PolygonHotSpot.Cstr/CS/polygonhotspot.cstrcs.aspx#1)] --> <!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-vb[PolygonHotSpot.Cstr#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/PolygonHotSpot.Cstr/VB/polygonhotspot.cstrvb.aspx#1)] -->

Docs.summary: A string of coordinates that represents the vertexes of a object.
Docs.value: A string that represents the coordinates of a object's vertexes.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PolygonHotSpot.Coordinates%2A> property to specify the coordinates of the vertexes of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PolygonHotSpot> object. A polygon vertex is a point at which two polygon edges meet. The string that you specify must be formatted with each coordinate separated by a comma. Each vertex that you specify must have both an x- coordinate and a y-coordinate. For example, the string "128,185,335,157,510,224,510,383,228,383" defines a polygon hot spot with five vertexes. The x-coordinate of the first vertex is 128. The y-coordinate of the first vertex is 185.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to programmatically create a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PolygonHotSpot> object and add it to an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ImageMap> control. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PolygonHotSpot.Coordinates%2A> property is used to specify the coordinates of the vertexes of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PolygonHotSpot> object. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ImageMap> control contains two other <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PolygonHotSpot> objects that have been added declaratively. Each <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PolygonHotSpot> object represents a geographical region on the map. When the user clicks a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PolygonHotSpot> object, it posts back to the server and the type and name of the hot spot are displayed in a label.
<!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-csharp[PolygonHotSpot.Cstr#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/PolygonHotSpot.Cstr/CS/polygonhotspot.cstrcs.aspx#1)] --> <!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-vb[PolygonHotSpot.Cstr#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/PolygonHotSpot.Cstr/VB/polygonhotspot.cstrvb.aspx#1)] -->

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance string GetCoordinates() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a string that represents the coordinates of the vertexes of a object.
Docs.returns: A string that represents the coordinates of the vertexes of a object. The default value is an empty string ("").

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PolygonHotSpot.GetCoordinates%2A> method returns a string that represents the coordinates of the vertexes of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PolygonHotSpot> object. The string this method returns is the current value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PolygonHotSpot.Coordinates%2A> property.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PolygonHotSpot.GetCoordinates%2A> method is used internally by ASP.NET to get the text to use for the coordinates of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PolygonHotSpot> when it is rendered. The string that is returned is specific to the browser and markup language.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ImageMap> control that contains three <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PolygonHotSpot> objects. Each <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PolygonHotSpot> object represents a geographical region on the map. When the user clicks a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PolygonHotSpot> object, it posts back to the server. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PolygonHotSpot.GetCoordinates%2A> method retrieves the coordinates of the polygon's vertexes so that they can be displayed in a label.
